verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying ,

Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; Stand in the court of the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* house , and speak unto all the cities of Judah , which come to worship in the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* house , all the words that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word :
If so be they will hearken , and turn every man from his evil way , that I may repent me of the evil , which I purpose to do unto them because of the evil of their doings.
And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law , which I have set before you,
To hearken to the words of my servants the prophets , whom I sent unto you, both rising up early , and sending \add them\add*, but ye have not hearkened ;
Then will I make this house like Shiloh , and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth. \p
So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p

¶ Now it came to pass, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had commanded \add him\add* to speak unto all the people , that the priests and the prophets and all the people took him, saying , Thou shalt surely die.

Why hast thou prophesied in the name of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, saying , This house shall be like Shiloh , and this city shall be desolate without an inhabitant ? And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p

¶ When the princes of Judah heard these things , then they came up from the king’s house unto the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and sat down in the entry of the new gate of the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add house\add*.  +  r 26.10  t in the…: or, at the door *

Then spake the priests and the prophets unto the princes and to all the people , saying , This man \add is\add* worthy to die ; for he hath prophesied against this city , as ye have heard with your ears.\f + \fr 26.11 \ft This man…: Heb. The judgment of death is for this man\f* \p

¶ Then spake Jeremiah unto all the princes and to all the people , saying , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that ye have heard.

Therefore now amend your ways and your doings , and obey the voice of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your God ; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will repent him of the evil that he hath pronounced against you.
As for me, behold, I \add am\add* in your hand : do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.\f + \fr 26.14 \ft as…: Heb. as it is good and right in your eyes\f*

But know ye for certain , that if ye put me to death , ye shall surely bring innocent blood upon yourselves, and upon this city , and upon the inhabitants thereof: for of a truth the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath sent me unto you to speak all these words in your ears. \p

¶ Then said the princes and all the people unto the priests and to the prophets ; This man \add is\add* not worthy to die : for he hath spoken to us in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God.
Then rose up certain of the elders of the land , and spake to all the assembly of the people , saying ,

Micah the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah , and spake to all the people of Judah , saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts ; Zion shall be plowed \add like\add* a field , and Jerusalem shall become heaps , and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.

Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him at all to death ? did he not fear the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and besought the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our souls.  +  r 26.19  t the \+nd LORD\+nd*, and the: Heb. the face of the \+nd LORD\+nd*, etc *

And there was also a man that prophesied in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjath-jearim , who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah :

And when Jehoiakim the king , with all his mighty men , and all the princes , heard his words , the king sought to put him to death : but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid , and fled , and went into Egypt ;
And Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt , \add namely\add*, Elnathan the son of Achbor , and \add certain\add* men with him into Egypt.

And they fetched forth Urijah out of Egypt , and brought him unto Jehoiakim the king ; who slew him with the sword , and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.\f + \fr 26.23 \ft common…: Heb. sons of the people\f*
Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah , that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
